definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Philip is a phenomenon in math. He always gets 100% on tests.
sentences.chinese: 非利普是个数学天才，他总是在测验时获满分。

sentences.english: They were then given a 20-point scale to use to rate their pain after each shock.
sentences.chinese: 她们将感受到的痛感运用20分满分的方式进行区隔。

sentences.english: She aced out on that test in French.
sentences.chinese: 那次法语测验她得了满分。

sentences.english: Quizzes are scored on a 100-point scale.
sentences.chinese: 随堂考试以100分为满分计算成绩。

sentences.english: By this measure, Zhu deserves full marks.
sentences.chinese: 这样量度，朱先生可以拿满分。

sentences.english: He gained full marks in the examination.
I gave today's restaurant a one-out-of-ten rating.
sentences.chinese: 今天那家餐厅，如果满分十分，我只给它打一分。

sentences.english: Iguodala had a 50-point slam in each round.
sentences.chinese: 伊古奥达拉在每一轮的比赛中都有一个满分的动作。

sentences.english: Poor kid, just lack one point to gett full score.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的孩子，差一点儿满分了。

sentences.english: If it is a composition of the university entrance exam, i must give it a full goal.
sentences.chinese: 如果是高考作文，我一定给上天打满分的。

sentences.english: Creatively you are hitting all "10s" in your life.
sentences.chinese: 有创造性的你一生都要求达到满分。

sentences.english: A:He gets full mark in this quiz.
It was such an easy test that almost all the students got full marks.
sentences.chinese: 考试太简单了，几乎所有的学生都考满分。

sentences.english: Because I can get perfect scores in Chinese, math and English.
sentences.chinese: 因为我语文，数学和英语都能得满分。

sentences.english: Not brilliant, Robyn, but I'll give you ten out of ten for effort.
sentences.chinese: 做得不算顶好，罗宾，但要论卖力气我给你打满分。

sentences.english: The pistol rapid fire project perfect score is 600 minute.
sentences.chinese: 手枪速射项目的满分是600分。

definition: to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
passing line or score (in an examination)
negative score/minus (in grades, such as A-)
to grade/to mark (student's work)/grade/score (of student's work)
off the charts/extreme/beyond the normal range of measurement
to deduct marks (when grading school work)/to have marks deducted/penalty points/to lose points for a penalty or error
